Main_Event_Assessment_With_Annotation: Tropical Storm Dujuan, known in the Philippines as Severe Tropical Storm Auring, was a tropical storm which caused heavy rain in the Philippines and Palau, leading to minor damage. Dujuan was the second depression and first named storm of the 2021 Pacific typhoon season.

Total_Summary_Death.Total_Death_Annotation: In the Philippines, one person was reported dead with four others reported missing.

Total_Death_Per_Country.Death_with_annotation: In the Philippines, one person was reported dead with four others reported missing.
Dujuan caused no casualties in Palau.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Death.Death_with_annotation: In the Philippines, one person was reported dead with four others reported missing.

Total_Summary_Displacement.Total_Displacement_Annotation: A total of 280,881 individuals were affected in Northern Mindanao, Caraga, and in the Davao Region.

Total_Displacement_Per_Country.Displacement_with_annotation: A total of 280,881 individuals were affected in Northern Mindanao, Caraga, and in the Davao Region.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Displaceme.Displacement_with_annotation: A total of 280,881 individuals were affected in Northern Mindanao, Caraga, and in the Davao Region.
At least 183,226 of the affected individuals were taken to 950 various evacuation shelters in each region.

Location_with_Annotation.Palau: Dujuan briefly moved over Palau on February 16 as a tropical depression, bringing heavy rainfall to parts of the country.
Location_with_Annotation.Philippines: In the Philippines, however, the storm caused 1 death and left 4 missing.
Location_with_Annotation.Surigao del Sur: Floodwater inundated houses in Surigao del Sur, submerging Tandag City along with 3,168 hectares of cropland.
Location_with_Annotation.Tandag City: Floodwater inundated houses in Surigao del Sur, submerging Tandag City along with 3,168 hectares of cropland.
Location_with_Annotation.Northern Samar: The system was declared a tropical storm prior to its landfall in Batag Island, Laoang, Northern Samar on February 22.
Location_with_Annotation.Batag Island: The system was declared a tropical storm prior to its landfall in Batag Island, Laoang, Northern Samar on February 22.
Location_with_Annotation.Laoang: The system was declared a tropical storm prior to its landfall in Batag Island, Laoang, Northern Samar on February 22.
Location_with_Annotation.Rapu-Rapu Islands: Prior to crossing the Rapu-Rapu Islands in Albay, the PAGASA declared the storm as a low-pressure area and issued their final bulletin on the storm.
Location_with_Annotation.Albay: Prior to crossing the Rapu-Rapu Islands in Albay, the PAGASA declared the storm as a low-pressure area and issued their final bulletin on the storm.
Location_with_Annotation.Romblon: Classes and government work was suspended on February 22 in Romblon, Tacloban City, and Negros Oriental and in parts of Leyte, Cebu, Davao de Oro, and Surigao del Sur.
Location_with_Annotation.Tacloban City: Classes and government work was suspended on February 22 in Romblon, Tacloban City, and Negros Oriental and in parts of Leyte, Cebu, Davao de Oro, and Surigao del Sur.
Location_with_Annotation.Negros Oriental: Classes and government work was suspended on February 22 in Romblon, Tacloban City, and Negros Oriental and in parts of Leyte, Cebu, Davao de Oro, and Surigao del Sur.
Location_with_Annotation.Leyte: Classes and government work was suspended on February 22 in Romblon, Tacloban City, and Negros Oriental and in parts of Leyte, Cebu, Davao de Oro, and Surigao del Sur.
Location_with_Annotation.Cebu: Classes and government work was suspended on February 22 in Romblon, Tacloban City, and Negros Oriental and in parts of Leyte, Cebu, Davao de Oro, and Surigao del Sur.
Location_with_Annotation.Davao de Oro: Classes and government work was suspended on February 22 in Romblon, Tacloban City, and Negros Oriental and in parts of Leyte, Cebu, Davao de Oro, and Surigao del Sur.
Location_with_Annotation.Northern Mindanao: A total of 280,881 individuals were affected in Northern Mindanao, Caraga, and in the Davao Region.
Location_with_Annotation.Caraga: A total of 280,881 individuals were affected in Northern Mindanao, Caraga, and in the Davao Region.
Location_with_Annotation.Davao Region: A total of 280,881 individuals were affected in Northern Mindanao, Caraga, and in the Davao Region.
Location_with_Annotation.Eastern Samar: Signal 2 warnings were also issued in the majority of Eastern Samar, Samar, Southern Leyte, Dinagat Islands, and Surigao del Norte on February 21 as Dujuan re-intensified hours before landfall.
Location_with_Annotation.Samar: Signal 2 warnings were also issued in the majority of Eastern Samar, Samar, Southern Leyte, Dinagat Islands, and Surigao del Norte on February 21 as Dujuan re-intensified hours before landfall.
Location_with_Annotation.Southern Leyte: Signal 2 warnings were also issued in the majority of Eastern Samar, Samar, Southern Leyte, Dinagat Islands, and Surigao del Norte on February 21 as Dujuan re-intensified hours before landfall.
Location_with_Annotation.Dinagat Islands: Signal 2 warnings were also issued in the majority of Eastern Samar, Samar, Southern Leyte, Dinagat Islands, and Surigao del Norte on February 21 as Dujuan re-intensified hours before landfall.
Location_with_Annotation.Surigao del Norte: Signal 2 warnings were also issued in the majority of Eastern Samar, Samar, Southern Leyte, Dinagat Islands, and Surigao del Norte on February 21 as Dujuan re-intensified hours before landfall.

Total_Summary_Damage.Total_Economic_Damage_Assessment_with_an: Total damages in the Philippines amounted to at least $3.29 million (2021 USD).

Total_Economic_Damage_Per_Country.Total_Economic_Damage_Assessment_with_an: Total damages in the Philippines amounted to at least $3.29 million (2021 USD).
Aon estimates that total losses in the Philippines reached at least $10 million (2021 USD).

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Economic_D.Economic_Damage_Assessment_with_annotati: Floodwater inundated houses in Surigao del Sur, submerging Tandag City along with 3,168 hectares of cropland.
Most of the damage occurred in the Caraga Administrative Region.

Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation.Rainfall: Dujuan briefly moved over Palau on February 16 as a tropical depression, bringing heavy rainfall to parts of the country.
Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation.Flood: Floodwater inundated houses in Surigao del Sur, submerging Tandag City along with 3,168 hectares of cropland.
Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation.Landfall: The storm made landfall over Batag Island in Laoang, Northern Samar at 09:00 PHT (01:00 UTC) on the same day.
